timeline.bodyText: I think this can be final (assuming proper initialization below).
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: if you make this private static final and use a MethodHandle it will definitely be constant folded by the JIT compiler and it would be as good as calling the method itself.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: Yes, I agree.  We should use MethodHandle whenever we can.  MethodHandles will tend to perform as well or better than reflection.  Both MethodHandles & reflection will generate classes, but MethodHandles do so without also requiring a ClassLoader and the generated class doesn't need to processed by instrumentation.
replies.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: I wish the DSL just let us embed child matchers inside of parents,  but until then, I think this is a reasonable step forward.

replies.bodyText: This is copying the behavior of other there server instrumentations.  There are bigger questions around different statuses, the tracer setting 500 even when the exception is handled, and mapping exceptions to different statuses.
